description: Single storey rear extension (following demolition of existing conservatory and shed) and replacement of windows with double-glazed white painted timber casement windows
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 20/J/00 (Location plan and drawings schedule); 20/J/01 Rev. A (Existing and proposed site and roof plans); 20/J/02 (Existing ground floor plan); 20/J/03 (Existing first floor plan); 20/J/04 (Existing loft plan); 20/J/05 Rev. A (Existing front elevation); 20/J/06 (Existing rear elevation); 20/J/07 (Existing side elevations); 20/J/12 Rev. A (Proposed ground floor plan); 20/J/13 Rev. A (Proposed first floor plan); 20/J/14 (Proposed loft plan); 20/J/15 Rev. B (Proposed front elevation); 20/J/16 Rev. A (Proposed rear elevation); 20/J/17 Rev. A (Proposed side elevations) (final revisions for single storey rear received 17.05.2021; final revisions for front elevation received 21.05.2021)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site. The brick work shall be carried out to the specifications within the plans, utilizing bricks which exactly match the existing in colour, size and mass.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2008), policy D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7.B of the Development Management, Development Plan Document (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); policy D4 of the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Apart from being double-glazed, the replacement fenestration shall be exact like-for-like replacements of the existing, including the number, size, and orientation of individual panes; the colour of spacers; the means of fixing; the placement and construction of hinges; and the materials, colour and form of the frames.

Reason: To ensure that the replacement windows harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with the Brentham Garden Estate Conservation Area Management Plan (2008), policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
